'''AdBrite, Inc.''' is an [[online]] [[advertising network]] based in [[San Francisco, California]]. It was founded by [[Philip J. Kaplan]] and Gidon Wise.
AdBrite serves advertisements on 112,009 sites, according to their published statistics <ref>[http://www.adbrite.com/ AdBrite statistics]</ref>, and is the 10th largest advertising network on the Internet, according to [[comScore]]<ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/20080703103618/http://www.comscore.com/press/release.asp?id=1177 comScore Media Metrix Releases December Top 50 Web Rankings and Analysis]</ref>. [[Attributor]] survey ranked AdBrite as the 6th largest ad server in 2008 with a 2% share of the market.<ref>[http://attributor.com/blog/?p=37 6th largest ad server in the world]</ref>
AdBrite was originally founded as Marketbanker.com in 2002, and relaunched as AdBrite in 2004. AdBrite is backed by [[Sequoia Capital]],<ref>[http://www.sequoiacap.com/company/adbrite/ Companies - AdBrite<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[Mitsui]], and [[DAG Ventures]].
On February 12, 2008 the company launched Spottt.com, a link exchange program that enables sites to promote each other for free.<ref>[http://www.techrecipe.co.cc/2008/12/making-money-with-adbrite.html Spottt Reincarnates LinkExchange<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
